translated: Likewise, this special meditative stabilization, the yogi's mind and mental factors liberated from ordinary conceptuality, is called the just-so emanation mandala because it is similar in aspect to the mandala of the Tathagatas' form bodies that are cultivated.

original: rnam pa 'dra bar mos pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu la rgyu de ji lta bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dra bar mos pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu la rgyu de ji lta bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the just-so emanation mandala because it is similar in aspect to the result, and because the cause is applied just-so to the result.

original: gang du sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor de rjes su dran pa'i rten gyur pa dang rnam pa 'dra ba'ang rung ste /
analyzed: gang du sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor de rjes su dran pa'i rten gyur pa dang rnam pa 'dra ba'ang rung ste /
translated: The just-so emanation mandala is the basis for recollecting the emanation mandala, and it is similar in aspect to it.

original: rdul tshon dang bris skur byas pa la sogs pa yang ji lta bar sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdul tshon dang bris skur byas pa la sogs pa yang ji lta bar sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: The just-so emanation mandala is also called the just-so emanation mandala because it is made of colored powders or painted images, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis tha mal pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos kyi dbyings dag pa ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis la gzhol ba'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin yang dkyil 'khor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis tha mal pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos kyi dbyings dag pa ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis la gzhol ba'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin yang dkyil 'khor zhes bya ste /
translated: Likewise, the yogis' and yoginis' dharmadhatu in its ordinary state, which is not pure, and their wisdom and samadhi, which are directed toward the two kinds of no-self, are also called mandala.

original: 'bras bu nye bar brtags pa las gnod pa med pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu nye bar brtags pa las gnod pa med pas so //

original: de ltar de dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i 'bras bu'i dkyil 'khor thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po'i phyir na dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i 'bras bu'i dkyil 'khor thob pa'i thabs kyi dngos po'i phyir na dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Thus, they are mandalas because they are the means for attaining the mandala of the nonconceptual result.üîΩAs to the meaning of mandala, the Tantra of Vairochanas Enlightenment states:

original: ji skad du dkyil ni snying po'o //
analyzed: ji skad du dkyil ni snying po'o //

analyzed: 'khor ni len pa'o zhes rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa bzhin no //

analyzed: de ltar de dag ni rgyud bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor du brjod do //

original: de'i rnam par dbye ba yang ji ltar bstan pa'i phyogs las rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dbye ba yang ji ltar bstan pa'i phyogs las rnam pa bdun te /

analyzed: rgyas par dbye ba la ni tshad med do //

original: de'i ming gi don kyang snying po 'dzin par byed pa zhes bye brag med par byas te /
analyzed: de'i ming gi don kyang snying po 'dzin par byed pa zhes bye brag med par byas te /

analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ni de thob pa'i thabs phul du byung ba yin pas 'di dag thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'brel ba khyad par can dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan don phun tshogs sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: The perfection of the welfare of others is asserted to be

original: dkyil 'khor de yang rgyu dang 'bras bus sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i don du 'gyur bas 'di don chen por nye bar gnas pa'i phyir 'bad pas bshad par rigs so zhes bya ba ni lam dang 'bras bu'i go rims so //

original: da ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bsdu bar bya ba la su zhig snod du gyur pa yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bsdu bar bya ba la su zhig snod du gyur pa yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach who is a suitable vessel for the master‚Äôs rite of the ma·πá·∏çala,

analyzed: de la dam tshig la sogs pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dang po bsnyen pa'i cho ga gsungs pas de'i go rims brjod de /

analyzed: 'di na thog ma med pa'i dus nas byas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa phyag rgya dang gsang sngags dang ting nge 'dzin sgrub pa la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the obscurations that interrupt the practice of seals, mantras, and meditative stabilizations, which have been performed since beginningless time with body, speech, and mind,

analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i theg pa chen po 'dir sems gtso bor gyur pas de sbyang ba sngar bstan cing /

translated: Then, one should emanate oneself as a blazing vajra like the fire of the sun from the syllable hum, and so on, up to vajra bandha bam.

original: bden mod kyis 'on kyang @193a * //
analyzed: bden mod kyis 'on kyang @193a * //
translated: True, but

original: nyes pa med de /
analyzed: nyes pa med de /

original: 'di na gang zag gnyis te rang gi bya ba tsam sems shing mchog tu mnyam par gzhag pa nang gi bdag nyid la lhag par gzhol ba'i rnal 'byor pa dang / de las gzhan pa dkyil 'khor chen po spros pa la zhugs pas slob ma'i don byed pa'o //

translated: Here there are two kinds of persons: the yogi who thinks only of his own actions and is supremely equipoised, who is intent on the inner self, and the other who is engaged in the elaboration of the great mandala and is working for the sake of the disciples.

analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya mchog tu mi zad pa drag cing rno ba dag gis bsrung ba chen po bya dgos pas nyes pa med do //

analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /

original: mtshan nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la @202b byed par sbyor bas na rnal 'byor ro //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa pos rang lhag par gnas pa dang bdag nyid rdzogs par bya ba gnyis ka spangs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa pos rang lhag par gnas pa dang bdag nyid rdzogs par bya ba gnyis ka spangs te /
translated: The reciter of the TathƒÅgata abandons both the special abode of the self and the perfection of the self.

original: mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i 'og tu blta ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad lus la gzhug pa la sogs pa lnga dang / yi ge brgya pas brtan par bya ba la sogs pa byas la dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog bsgom mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i 'og tu blta ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad lus la gzhug pa la sogs pa lnga dang / yi ge brgya pas brtan par bya ba la sogs pa byas la dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog bsgom mo zhes zer ro //
translated: After the five manifest enlightenments, one should perform the five such as the seeing and the entry of all the Tathagatas into the body, and the stabilization with the hundred syllable mantra, and meditate on the supreme royal mandala.

original: de ni mi 'thad de de la yang phyag rgya'i nga rgyal bsgom pa la sogs pa cho ga'i yan lag khas blang bar bya ba rgyud las gsungs pa nges pa dag dor bar mi bya la /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de de la yang phyag rgya'i nga rgyal bsgom pa la sogs pa cho ga'i yan lag khas blang bar bya ba rgyud las gsungs pa nges pa dag dor bar mi bya la /
translated: That is not correct, because in that case also, one should not abandon the definite statements in the tantra of the branches of the rite such as the meditation on the pride of the seal, and so on.

original: sems dpa' la sogs pa lus la dgod pa yang nyes pa ma mthong bas so //
analyzed: sems dpa' la sogs pa lus la dgod pa yang nyes pa ma mthong bas so //
translated: And the arrangement of the sattva and so on in the body is also not seen to be faulty.

original: de ltar don bsdus te bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don bsdus te bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the summary,

original: tshig gi don 'ba' zhig brjod de /
analyzed: tshig gi don 'ba' zhig brjod de /
translated: he will now state only the meaning of the words.

original: nam mkha'i phyogs su mdun nyid du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni lha re re la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re re ste de nyid sngags kyi zhes smras pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs su mdun nyid du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni lha re re la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re re ste de nyid sngags kyi zhes smras pas so //
translated: In the sky region, in front, is the moon mandala. This means that for each deity there is a moon mandala, and that is the mantra, as it is said.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje'i bdag nyid bdag ste zhes pa ni snying po brjod pas phyag rgya rdo rje lcags kyu mda' dgu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa der babs pa ste /

original: 'og mi na sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gnas pa'i rang gi sems dpa'i thugs ka nas 'dir phab pas so //
analyzed: 'og mi na sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gnas pa'i rang gi sems dpa'i thugs ka nas 'dir phab pas so //
translated: They descend from the heart of the deity of one's own mind that resides in the emanation mandala below.

original: gzhan dag ni nam kha'i ngos de nyid las 'thon te phab pa ni de dag chos kyi skus khyab pa'i phyir gang na yang bzhugs pa ji ltar rgyud las rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i gleng bzhi smos pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nam kha'i ngos de nyid las 'thon te phab pa ni de dag chos kyi skus khyab pa'i phyir gang na yang bzhugs pa ji ltar rgyud las rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i gleng bzhi smos pa lta bu yin la /
translated: Others say that they emerge from the very same side of the sky and descend there because they pervade the dharmakƒÅya and thus abide nowhere, just as the Tantra of the Great Heruka states.

original: de dag gi sprul pa byin gyis brlab pa yang gang du gdul bya rnyed pa der 'byung ba'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sprul pa byin gyis brlab pa yang gang du gdul bya rnyed pa der 'byung ba'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Also, the emanations of those deities bless the disciples wherever they are found.

analyzed: gzhan dag ni rang lhag par gnas pa'i dus su dkyil @206a * //
translated: Others say that at the time of the individual's own consecration, the deities are invited to the mandala base.

original: 'khor sprul pa rgya chen po gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa bdag nyid rdzogs par byed pa ni snying gar zla ba gcig la brtan par gyur pas na gcig pa can te /
analyzed: 'khor sprul pa rgya chen po gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa bdag nyid rdzogs par byed pa ni snying gar zla ba gcig la brtan par gyur pas na gcig pa can te /
translated: The extensive emanation circle with its immeasurable palace is perfected by oneself, and since it is stabilized on a single moon at the heart, it is single.

original: dpung gcig dang nags gcig ces pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpung gcig dang nags gcig ces pa bzhin no //

original: des na de'i thugs ka nas dbab ces zer na /

analyzed: snga ma la yang bsgrub pa mi dmigs pas lugs dang po gzung ngo //

analyzed: rdo rje de yang 'od zer mang po 'phros pas 'gro ba sbyangs te slar 'dus pa las gzugs 'grub par bya'o //

analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'og nas badzra aam ku sha dza: zhes pa la sogs pa dang / las kyi phyag rgya bya bar bstan pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir rdo rje'i rigs ni sems kyi ngo bor rgyud las grags la /

analyzed: rin po ches dbang bskur ba'i gnas ni dpral ba'i gnas yin pas der rin po che'o ;

original: / sems rtog pa las brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: / sems rtog pa las brtsams nas ni //

analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //

analyzed: padma'i rigs ni ngag gi rigs yin la /

analyzed: de bas na de dag ni ngag gi gnas dag tu'o ;

original: / chos thams cad rten cing 'brel pa tsam du ston pa dang / sangs rgyas ma lus pa'i phrin las mdzad pa'i rtags su spyi bor rtse mo bcu gnyis pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje kha cig la bsgom par rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la la las gsungs pas /

translated: In order to show that all phenomena are mere dependent origination and as a sign of the activity of all buddhas, some yoginis say that one should visualize a multicolored vajra with twelve prongs on the crown.

analyzed: de nyid ni sems dpa' rdo rje rgyal por shes @206b bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i spyi bor ro //

analyzed: yan lag thams cad dang bcas par bsrung bas na de yan lag dag las de rkang lag la'o gnyis kyi tshig can ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: Since it protects all the limbs, it is on his hands and feet. The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is as before.

analyzed: gnod sbyin ltar 'jigs pa'i mche ba ni kha na snang bas de khar ro //
translated: The fangs are terrifying like yakshas, and so they are in his mouth.

analyzed: sgeg pa'i khu tshur 'chang bas 'gying ba ni khu tshur ston pas dku g-yas par ro //
translated: The gesture of the playful fist is the display of the fist, and so it is on his right side.

original: gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi ni sems dpa' chen po dang 'dra bar rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gir mdzad pas de dag gi drung du'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi ni sems dpa' chen po dang 'dra bar rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gir mdzad pas de dag gi drung du'o //

original: shin tu skyid de bar bskyed pa'i 'jig rten dag bdug spos kyi dri mdo mas kyi phyogs kyi 'dzag sgo dag kyang dri zhim pos bdugs te longs spyod pa'i lus kyi de mdo mas su ste mtshan rtags su'o //

translated: The world is generated with great pleasure, and so it is in the direction of the nose. The nose is perfumed with the scent of incense, and so it is in the body of enjoyment.

original: kha cig tu bdug spos mdun du'o zhes pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor la'o zhes bstan pa ni lus la dgod pa'i dbang du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu bdug spos mdun du'o zhes pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor la'o zhes bstan pa ni lus la dgod pa'i dbang du ma byas pa'o //
translated: In some places, incense is in front, and it is taught that the circle of light is in the eyes. This is not from the point of view of placing them on the body.

original: lus can rnams la mdzes par bya ba'i phyir me tog phred rgyan dang / rna rgyan la sogs pas mgo brgyan par byed pas phreng ba'i gnas mgo ste spyi bo'i gtsug go //
analyzed: lus can rnams la mdzes par bya ba'i phyir me tog phred rgyan dang / rna rgyan la sogs pas mgo brgyan par byed pas phreng ba'i gnas mgo ste spyi bo'i gtsug go //
translated: The place of garlands is the head, the crown of the head, because one adorns the head with garlands, earrings, and so on, in order to beautify embodied beings.

original: mar me ni mig gi yul snang bar byed pas mig la phan pa ste /
analyzed: mar me ni mig gi yul snang bar byed pas mig la phan pa ste /
translated: The lamp is in the eyes, because it benefits the eyes by illuminating the visual object.

original: ji skad du mig gi dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ste ;
analyzed: ji skad du mig gi dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ste ;
translated: As it is said: From the eye faculty, the object, and attention, there is visual consciousness.

original: des na de mig la'o //
analyzed: des na de mig la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is in the eyes.

original: rab tu dri zhim pa dang bsil bar bya ba'i phyir skyid de ba dag snying gar tsandan gyi lde gu la sogs pa nyug pas dri'i gnas ni de'o //
analyzed: rab tu dri zhim pa dang bsil bar bya ba'i phyir skyid de ba dag snying gar tsandan gyi lde gu la sogs pa nyug pas dri'i gnas ni de'o //
translated: The place of perfume is the heart, because one anoints the heart with sandalwood paste and so on, in order to be fragrant and cool.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sgo bzhi nas byed cing de la rag las la brla gnyis dang byin pa gnyis te rkang pa dag gis kyang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la dbang byed pas 'di dag sgo dang chos mthun pas de dag tu sgo skyong dag bzhag
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sgo bzhi nas byed cing de la rag las la brla gnyis dang byin pa gnyis te rkang pa dag gis kyang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la dbang byed pas 'di dag sgo dang chos mthun pas de dag tu sgo skyong dag bzhag
translated: The four doors are the two shoulders and the two hips, since the four doors are made by the four doors, and they are dependent on them. The two thighs and the two calves, that is, the feet, also control going and coming. These are similar to doors, so the door guardians are placed in them.

original: la / go rims mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ni g-yas nas dang steng nas so //
analyzed: la / go rims mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ni g-yas nas dang steng nas so //
translated: In order to not violate the order, they are on the right and above.

original: 'dir mngon par yid ches pa'i rgyu mtshan 'tsham pa'i gnas su 'di dag sbyar gyi gang du bkod kyang dngos grub du byed do //
analyzed: 'dir mngon par yid ches pa'i rgyu mtshan 'tsham pa'i gnas su 'di dag sbyar gyi gang du bkod kyang dngos grub du byed do //
translated: Here, these are applied to the appropriate reasons for clear confidence, but wherever they are placed, they are the cause of spiritual powers.

original: 'on kyang 'tsham par bstan pa 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'tsham par bstan pa 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: However, the teaching of the appropriate is the cause of engagement.

original: de dang de la goms pas mthong gi gzhan ma yin ba dang / 'tsham pa de nyid dngos grub kyi rgyur bsngags te bskyed par rung bas na'o //
analyzed: de dang de la goms pas mthong gi gzhan ma yin ba dang / 'tsham pa de nyid dngos grub kyi rgyur bsngags te bskyed par rung bas na'o //
translated: It is seen through being accustomed to this and that, not to something else, and that very appropriateness is praised as the cause of spiritual powers, because it is suitable to generate.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas lnga ni dbu rgyan du bzhugs @207a * //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas lnga ni dbu rgyan du bzhugs @207a * //
translated: Here, the five buddhas reside in the crown.

original: pa dang / sems ma rdo rje ma la sogs pa yang gnas bzhir byin gyis brlabs nas bzhugs pas 'di dag la dgod pa phye ste ma bstan to //
analyzed: pa dang / sems ma rdo rje ma la sogs pa yang gnas bzhir byin gyis brlabs nas bzhugs pas 'di dag la dgod pa phye ste ma bstan to //
translated: and Vajra Mind and so on are also present consecrating the four places.

original: kha cig na re lus la lha 'di dag bkod pa ni rnal 'byor rgya chen po yin pas /
analyzed: kha cig na re lus la lha 'di dag bkod pa ni rnal 'byor rgya chen po yin pas /
translated: Some say: Arranging these deities on the body is a vast yoga.

original: rnal 'byor chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The great yoga is as follows:

original: rang lhag par gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang lhag par gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not the individual consecration.

original: de ni yang dag ma yin te gal te rang lhag par gnas pa ma byas na lha'i lus su ma gyur pas lus la lha de dag dgod pa'i gnas rang du yang mi 'gyur ba dang / 'di rang lhag par gnas pa'i yan lag tsam du rab tu gsal ba'i phyir dang ;
analyzed: de ni yang dag ma yin te gal te rang lhag par gnas pa ma byas na lha'i lus su ma gyur pas lus la lha de dag dgod pa'i gnas rang du yang mi 'gyur ba dang / 'di rang lhag par gnas pa'i yan lag tsam du rab tu gsal ba'i phyir dang ;
translated: That is incorrect, because if the individual consecration is not performed, the body would not become the deity's body and the body would not become the place for arranging those deities.üîΩAnd it is clear that this is merely a branch of the individual consecration.

original: phyag rgya gcig pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor la rnal 'byor chen po tsam bya bar ston pa na dkyil 'khor mi sgom par lus la dkyil 'khor dgod pa mi rigs shing lus lhar bya ba'i cho ga med par de lta bu de la yang 'gyur bas lha
analyzed: phyag rgya gcig pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor la rnal 'byor chen po tsam bya bar ston pa na dkyil 'khor mi sgom par lus la dkyil 'khor dgod pa mi rigs shing lus lhar bya ba'i cho ga med par de lta bu de la yang 'gyur bas lha
translated: And since that would also be the case without the rite of making the body into a deity,

original: de lta bu de spang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu de spang ngo //
translated: one should abandon such a practice.

original: de ltar phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas dngos grub thams cad rab tu sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas dngos grub thams cad rab tu sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having thus sealed with the four mudras, it grants all powers.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa de dag ni sku gsung thugs phrin las dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The tathagatas and so on are body, speech, mind and activity.

original: de la dam tshig dang chos dang phyag rgya chen po dag ni thugs dang gsung dang sku'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la dam tshig dang chos dang phyag rgya chen po dag ni thugs dang gsung dang sku'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Among them, the commitments, dharma and great mudras are the nature of mind, speech and body.

original: las kyi phyag rgya ni phrin las te /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya ni phrin las te /
translated: The action mudra is activity.

original: de yang thugs ni bdag gi don yin la /
analyzed: de yang thugs ni bdag gi don yin la /
translated: Moreover, mind is for one's own benefit,

original: sku la sogs pa gzhan gyi don te bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin la gzhag pa ni ji lta ba'i gnas skabs thob pas dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gzhan gyi don te bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin la gzhag pa ni ji lta ba'i gnas skabs thob pas dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur te /
translated: The benefit of others is the body, and so on, and the establishment in the nature of the perfection of one's own and others' goals is the bestowal of spiritual powers by attaining the state of reality.

original: des na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud ma lus par phyag rgya bzhi bsdus pa dang rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud ma lus par phyag rgya bzhi bsdus pa dang rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the entire yoga tantra is summarized in the four seals and is taught extensively.

original: aom badzra satva su sam gra ha ta zhes bya ba nas dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa rdzogs pa'i bar 'dis ni bdag nyid brtan par bya zhing gzengs bstod pa ste /

original: ces gsungs shing rang byung gi ye shes zhes pa bya ba'ang gsungs la /üîΩrang sangs rgyas kyang rang gi shes pas 'bras bu thob na /
analyzed: ces gsungs shing rang byung gi ye shes zhes pa bya ba'ang gsungs la / rang sangs rgyas kyang rang gi shes pas 'bras bu thob na /
translated: Also, the term naturally occurring timeless awareness is used.

original: sngags kyi lam 'dir cis na bla ma la rag las pa gtsor byed ce na /
analyzed: sngags kyi lam 'dir cis na bla ma la rag las pa gtsor byed ce na /
translated: If one attains the fruition by means of one's own consciousness, why is it that in this spiritual approach of the transcendent and accomplished conqueror Vajradhara, one's reliance on a master is considered so important?

original: lam 'dir ni shin tu mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i bya ba dang / shin tu sbyang bar dka' ba'i bya ba bud med bsten pa la sogs pa yang dang yang bstan te /
analyzed: lam 'dir ni shin tu mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i bya ba dang / shin tu sbyang bar dka' ba'i bya ba bud med bsten pa la sogs pa yang dang yang bstan te /
translated: In this approach, one repeatedly engages in activities that are highly charged with characteristics and that are difficult to refine, such as relying on a consort.

original: de dag bstan pa med par ni theg pa chen po 'di la 'dun pa ches nyung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag bstan pa med par ni theg pa chen po 'di la 'dun pa ches nyung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Without such teachings, there would be very few who would aspire to this spiritual approach of the Great Vehicle.

original: de dag kyang de kho na ltar sgra ji bzhin du spyad par bya ba ma yin pas na dang po 'di la gzhug cing zhugs nas sgra ji bzhin pa'i lam gyis yongs su nyams pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang de kho na ltar sgra ji bzhin du spyad par bya ba ma yin pas na dang po 'di la gzhug cing zhugs nas sgra ji bzhin pa'i lam gyis yongs su nyams pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Since one should not engage in these practices literally, the purpose of these teachings is to introduce one to this approach and, once one has been introduced, to prevent one from straying from the literal path.

original: ches thabs dam pa ston pa'i bla ma la rag las par rigs te dge slong gi dngos po rnyed nas gnas bzhir bsgrags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ches thabs dam pa ston pa'i bla ma la rag las par rigs te dge slong gi dngos po rnyed nas gnas bzhir bsgrags pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is reasonable that the most excellent method depends on the guru who teaches it, just as the attainment of the state of a fully ordained monk depends on the proclamation in the four directions.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i 'bras bu ni dam par gyur pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i 'bras bu ni dam par gyur pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is no result of this meditative concentration that is more excellent.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not engage by the power of things.

original: de yang dngos po ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid du rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: de yang dngos po ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid du rnam par gnas la /
translated: Moreover, a thing is a reality that is endowed with all aspects and endowed with the most excellent of all aspects, and emptiness is the state of that reality.

original: de'i blo ni rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid la zhugs pas so //üîΩlhag ma rnams kyi tshig gi don @213a * //
analyzed: de'i blo ni rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid la zhugs pas so // lhag ma rnams kyi tshig gi don @213a * //
translated: But the mind of that meditative concentration is engaged in emptiness that is devoid of all aspects.

original: ni go sla'o //
analyzed: ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words of the remaining verses is easy to understand.

original: gzhan gyi don du dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i dang por cho ga de snyed kyis bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su grub par bya ba'i rnal 'byor rab tu rgyas pa 'di yin pas na dang po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhesüîΩbya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i dang por cho ga de snyed kyis bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su grub par bya ba'i rnal 'byor rab tu rgyas pa 'di yin pas na dang po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since this is the extensive one, it is called the samadhi called the first yoga.

original: de tsam gyis bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par 'grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par 'grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that by just that much, the perfect benefit for oneself is accomplished.

translated: Now, having accomplished the benefit for oneself just as it is, the display of the enjoyment of the exampleless retinue and abode is explained.

original: mu stegs byed phyugs lta bu lam ngan pa la gnas pa dag dang / kha cig lha dang mi'i 'byor pa la lhag par chags nas srid pa la gyen du 'byung bar mi rtsol ba dag la lha dang mi las yang dag par 'das pa'i rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug byin gyis brlabs pas /
analyzed: mu stegs byed phyugs lta bu lam ngan pa la gnas pa dag dang / kha cig lha dang mi'i 'byor pa la lhag par chags nas srid pa la gyen du 'byung bar mi rtsol ba dag la lha dang mi las yang dag par 'das pa'i rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug byin gyis brlabs pas /
translated: For the tƒ´rthikas, who are like cattle, who abide in bad paths, and for some who, being attached to the wealth of gods and humans, do not strive to rise up from existence, he blessed the sovereignty that completely transcends gods and humans.

original: de dag gis bde ba chen po 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang yid 'phrog par byed pa 'dir mngon par dga' bzhin du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir btsun mo dang / blon po dang / sras dang / g-yog mo dang ;
analyzed: de dag gis bde ba chen po 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang yid 'phrog par byed pa 'dir mngon par dga' bzhin du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir btsun mo dang / blon po dang / sras dang / g-yog mo dang ;
translated: In order to attract them, who desire the great bliss of the five sense objects, he manifested a queen, ministers, sons, and maidservants,

analyzed: rtse dgod dang bcas pa'i nang gi longs spyod dang / dpe med pa'i gnas dang rgyan bkod pa'i dkyil 'khor sbrul pa bstan te /

analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ni chos kyi rgyal po'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs ma pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ni blon po chen po lta bu'o // rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa bzhin ni btsun mo dam pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: rdo rje me tog la sogs pa ni g-yog mo dam pa rnams so ;

translated: The goddesses who captivate his mind, the precious parasols, banners, and divine garments,

analyzed: lda ldi mchog dang / bla re dang / rnga yab dkar po nor bu dang gser gyi yu ba can dang me long dang mu tig gi do shal dang do shal phyed pa dang mu tig dmar po'i sham bu dang dpe med bar dri zhim pa'i bdug pa dang dri dang lha'i las 'das pa'i bdud rtsi'i
translated: the supreme canopies, the nets, the white yak-tail fans with jeweled handles, the mirrors, the pearl necklaces, the half-necklaces, the red pearl tassels, the incomparable fragrant incense, the fragrances, and the various kinds of nectar that surpass those of the gods

analyzed: bye brag sna tshogs pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba dang bca' ba dang myang ba dang bldag pa dang / gzhib pa thams cad kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg pa phun sum tshogs pas gang ba /

analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das dang po gsang sngags kyi lam du sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te yun ring zhig tu dkyil 'khor chen por snang ba lta bu'i mchod pa byas shing ting nge 'dzin de lta bu yang yun shin tu ring bar goms par byas
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat, beginning from the time of generating the mind on the path of mantra, for a long time made offerings in the great mandala, like an appearance, and became very familiar with that samadhi for a very long time,

analyzed: pas / de'i 'bras bu grub pa la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dkyil 'khor sprul pas ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po byams pa la sogs pa yang lam bde ba 'dir mos par byas la 'dod pa'i lha'i rgyal po yang byang chub tu sems bskyed cing 'dzam bu'i gling du rgyal po ka pi ni
translated: By emanating a mandala with this aspect, the great bodhisattvas such as Maitreya are inspired on this path of bliss, and the king of desire realm gods generates the mind of enlightenment, and the king of Jambudvipa,

analyzed: yang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la bkod ces grags pas /

translated: Here, the meaning of the sequence is that immediately after performing the yoga of the first stage, one should imagine a moon seat in the abode of the deity.

translated: Then, after emanating the insignia, one should transform it into the form of that great being and so on, and the utterance of the declaration of the truth from the heart.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang bskur ba'i mthar yang ched du brjod pa smra bar blta ste /
translated: Then, after the empowerment, one should view the utterance of the declaration of the truth.

original: de ni go rims so //üîΩde la de nas rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mas gnas bzhir bdag nyid la byin gyis brlabs la zhes bya ba ni sngar dang po'i rnal 'byor gyi mthar bya ba ste /

translated: That is the sequence.üîΩThen VajradhƒÅtvƒ´≈õvarƒ´ should empower herself in the four places, which is done at the end of the first yoga as before.

analyzed: 'dir bstan pa ni dang po rnal 'byor byas ma thag tu @214a * //
translated: The teaching here is that immediately after performing the first yoga, one should imagine a moon seat in the abode of the deity.

analyzed: snying ga'i gnas su bla mas rdo rje phab pa ste /
translated: The Vajrasattva who is in one's heart is the Vajra placed by the guru in the heart center.

original: brjod pa gnyis sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod pa gnyis sngon bzhin no //
translated: The two expressions are as before.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad da ni rnam par snang mdzad nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad da ni rnam par snang mdzad nyid do //
translated: All Tathagatas are now Vairocana himself.

original: de nyid la sngar de bzhin gshegs pa zhugs pas so //
analyzed: de nyid la sngar de bzhin gshegs pa zhugs pas so //
translated: Because he previously entered into the Tathagatas,üîΩall the Buddhas are the five Tathagatas.

original: gzhan dag ni rang gi rigs kyi gdan rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka nas spros pa thams cad kyi sgras sangs rgyas lnga gzung zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rang gi rigs kyi gdan rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka nas spros pa thams cad kyi sgras sangs rgyas lnga gzung zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that all the Buddhas refers to the five Buddhas who are emanated from the heart of each of the Tathagatas of their own lineage, by the word all.

translated: Then, in order to show that each of the great beings, Maitreya and so on, is the nature of all, they are connected as the cause of each other.

translated: The meditation on the great vajra is the magical emanation of the power of the Tathagata Vairocana himself, the vajra of the bodhisattva, which is taught to arise from the dharmakaya.

translated: The phrase the size of the vajra that is in the heart is the blessing of the body that is in accord with the elements, and the form body is not able to be perceived as pervading the entire realm of space.

analyzed: rang gi lag tu gnas par bsam pa ni 'di dag bcom ldan 'das 'di'i phyag ltar gnas te skyes bu'i lag pa g-yas pa ltar dgos pa thams cad byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought it is in my hand is taught in order to show that it is like the hand of this Bhagavat, and that it performs all functions like the right hand of a person.

analyzed: thugs kar gyur pa'i rdo rje la zhugs pa ni de ni phyi rol gyi lus ma yin te de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase it enters into the vajra in the heart is taught in order to show that it is not an external body, but is the very mind of the Tathagata.

translated: Also, by these rites, it is taught that as many deities of the mandala as there are are the magical transformations of one's own intuition, and so it is that the conception of holding to other continuums is stopped.üîΩAlso, by the consecration with the diadems of the five Buddhas, they are consecrated with the highest consecration, and so on.

translated: They have come forth from the family of the five TathƒÅgatas, and

analyzed: gang du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la rin po che'i dbu rgyan gyis dbang bskur ba der ni /

analyzed: de @214b dag la khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i phul ba'i rtags kyis mtshan pa yin la /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor re re na yang sems dpa' chen po stong du bzhis ma tshang ba rnams 'khor cing dkyil 'khor chen po yongs su bskyang ba ltar bskor te gnas par mos par bya'o //
translated: Imagine that in each ma·πá·∏çala, the great bodhisattvas, less by four, circle and abide as if they were guarding the great ma·πá·∏çala.

original: 'dis ni rang gi lha'i tshogs ji snyed pa steng 'og dang thad kar phyogs dang mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can chen po dag gi don la gshegs par lhag par mos par bstan pa'o //

original: gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgyes par sgrub pa zhes bya ba thun mong gi dam tshig sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jug pa mos pa ltar dam pa'i chos kyi grong khyer bskyang ba zhes bya ba 'di yang thun mong gi tshig yin pas na lcags
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgyes par sgrub pa zhes bya ba thun mong gi dam tshig sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jug pa mos pa ltar dam pa'i chos kyi grong khyer bskyang ba zhes bya ba 'di yang thun mong gi tshig yin pas na lcags
translated: Others say that the so-called accomplishment of the delight of all the Tathagatas is a common pledge, and that the so-called protection of the city of the sublime Dharma is a common pledge for the Bodhisattvas.

original: kyu la sogs pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kyu la sogs pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: They say that the hook and so forth are the pledges of the Bodhisattvas.

original: de ni mi 'thad de gal te byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pa 'dir bsgom pa'i dkyil 'khor la med na phyis rdul tshon yang bri bar mi rigs te /

translated: That is not correct. If the Bodhisattvas such as Maitreya are not in the mandala of meditation here, it is not right to draw them later in the colored-powder mandala.

original: 'di ji ltar phyis rdul tshon du bri ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar phyis rdul tshon du bri ba'i rigs pas so //

analyzed: de dag kyang dam pa'i chos kyi grong khyer bskyang bas so zhes zer ro //

original: yang gzhan dag ni lha dang lha ma yin dang klu dang dri za la sogs pa'i 'khor bstan pa 'di la dad pa mi phyed pa rnams kyang 'dir bsgom par bya ste /

analyzed: las rnams kyi rgyal po ltar gtso bor gyur pas na las kyi rgyal po'o //

analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las zhes pa'i don to ;

original: / de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid gsum rnam par dag pas bsrung ba byas te tshogs rnam pa gnyis bsags shing gzhan gyi don byas nas bdag lhag par gnas pa dang bdag nyid rdzogs par bya ste /

translated: Then, one should think that all the mandala deities are established in the ten directions of the world in the activities. Thus, by the sequence of the ritual of all the perfections, the first yoga, the supreme king of mandalas, and the supreme king of activities are completed.

analyzed: gyis brlab cing /

translated: Here, the prior performance of this mandala ritual is the uncommon ritual, and so I have already stated a little about it. The ritual of conferring initiation on the disciples and so on is a general characteristic of the tantras, and so the text

translated: I will just give a summary of the sequence, so that it is easy to remember.

analyzed: de la 'dir dang po kho nar rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor ni sa la bri bar rigs pas sa sbyang zhing yongs su gzung ba bya zhing /

analyzed: de nas nyes pa dang bral ba'i sa la lha rnams byin gyis brlab tu rung bas der lha rnams sta gon la gnas par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bum pas dbang bskur dgos pas bum pa sta gon la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, since it is necessary to confer empowerment with the vase blessed by the deities, the vase should be established in the preparatory rite.

original: bum pas dbang bskur ba'i gnas ni slob ma yin pas /
analyzed: bum pas dbang bskur ba'i gnas ni slob ma yin pas /
translated: The disciples are the ones to be empowered by the vase.

original: de'i 'og tu slob ma sta gon la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu slob ma sta gon la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, after that, the disciples should be established in the preparatory rite.

original: slob ma snod du rung bar byas pa de dkyil 'khor du gzhug cing mngon par dbang bskur bar bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi thig gi cho ga bstan to //

translated: In order to purify the disciples and induct them into the mandala and confer the actual empowerment, the ritual of the lines of the mandala is explained.

original: dkyil 'khor thig 'debs pa'am rdul tshon 'gyed pa na bgegs 'byung ba srid @222a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thig 'debs pa'am rdul tshon 'gyed pa na bgegs 'byung ba srid @222a * //

original: pas bgegs bsal bar bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: pas bgegs bsal bar bya ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, the removal of obstacles has been taught.

original: de ltar thig btab cing bgegs dang bral nas rdul tshon bri bar rigs pas de bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar thig btab cing bgegs dang bral nas rdul tshon bri bar rigs pas de bstan to //
translated: Having thus laid out the grid and removed the obstacles, it is appropriate to draw the colored powders.

original: dkyil 'khor lhag par bgegs med cing mthu dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir ni khor yug tu rgyan dgod pa dang chos bsgrags pa dang bdug pa dbul ba la sogs pa bya'o //

translated: In order to make the ma·πá·∏çala especially free from obstacles and powerful, one should arrange the ornaments all around, proclaim the Dharma, offer incense, and so on.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya ba'i phyir slob dpon dkyil 'khor du 'jug cing /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya ba'i phyir slob dpon dkyil 'khor du 'jug cing /
translated: Then, in order to perform the ma·πá·∏çala activities, the master should enter the ma·πá·∏çala.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu bum pa bcug ste mchod pa dang phyag rgyal sogs pa ji srid lung bstan pa'i bar du byas la /

analyzed: mchod cing gsol ba btab nas gtor ma byin te 'jug pa'i sbyin sreg byas la dkyil 'khor la slob ma gzhug par bsgrags te thams cad snod du gyur par blta ba nas ji srid 'jug pa'i phyag rgya dgrol ba'i bar du slob ma gzhug pa'i cho ga rgya
translated: Having made offerings and supplications, give the torma, perform the preparatory burnt offering, and announce that the disciples should enter the mandala.üîΩ

analyzed: cher byas la / de nas mdor bsdus pa'am /

translated: medium, or extensive rite, whichever is appropriate.üîΩOne should give the secret gnosis, teach the mantra and yoga, give the secret injunction, and perform the rite of offering and permission.

analyzed: brtul zhugs byin la mna' bsgags la slob ma rnams slar btang ngo //

analyzed: 'di tsam kho nas 'di'i go rims che long bsdus pa'o //

original: da ni 'di tsam zhig bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di tsam zhig bsam par bya ste /
translated: Now, this much should be thought about.

original: de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga de dus ji srid cig gi dbang du byas rgyud gzhan kha cig las sa'i lha zhes bya ba sta gon la gnas pa'i cho ga bstan pa cis na 'dir ma smos /

translated: In that case, in terms of how long is that ritual of the ma·πá·∏çala, since in some other tantras the rite of remaining in the presence of the deity of the ground is taught, why is it not mentioned here?

analyzed: 'dir bstan pa'i dbang bskur ba'i cho ga gsum gyi bye brag ji tsam zhig tu nges /

translated: Thus, it is for three days.üîΩThus, in another Yoga Tantra,

translated: ‚ÄúThe first is the thorough apprehension of the basis,

analyzed: gal te shin tu brtad pa'am // bris sku'i dkyil 'khor du'am /

translated: If one is not in a hurry and is able, one should perform the offerings and recitations in the mandala for as long as four days and so forth up to a year and then confer the empowerment.

analyzed: gzhan dag ni ji srid zhag bdun gyi nang du rdzogs par bya ste /

analyzed: gzhan du na bar chad du 'gyur ba srid pa dang / ha cang dus yun ring por byas na thug pa med pa'i dus su 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes zer te /

analyzed: rgyud 'ga' zhig las bstan pa'i cho ga thams cad du sbyar ba'i nges pa med cing ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas so //

analyzed: gang dag cho ga rgyas pa la dga' bas de la zhes 'dun pa yod na yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas de dgag pa mdzad pa dang / gang du las ni yongs gyur la //

analyzed: las kyi cho ga rnams med pa // de ni spyir rgyud las grags pa'i //
translated: and no rite of action,üîΩthere the wise should know

translated: Likewise, all the rites not mentioned here, such as the protection of the disciple at the beginning of the time of prior service by way of preliminary questions, the offering to the earth goddess when purifying the ground, the direction of digging, the activity of the rosary of recitations, and so forth, which appear in other texts, should be performed as one likes, just as they are taught.

original: med du mi rung ba'i cho ga min pa dang / yod kyang nyes pa med pa'i cho ga yin pa ste /
analyzed: med du mi rung ba'i cho ga min pa dang / yod kyang nyes pa med pa'i cho ga yin pa ste /

analyzed: gtsug phung gzhag pa'i bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the activity of setting up the topknot.

original: de bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i cho ga rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag ni mdor bsdus pa'i cho ga la ni dbang bskur ba'i gnas dkyil 'khor tsam du zad la /

translated: Likewise, the three types of rites of conferring initiation are as follows: In the concise rite, the place of conferring initiation is just the mandala.

analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang dbugs dbyung ba ma smos te /
translated: The secret initiation and the permission are not mentioned.

analyzed: lung bstan pa'i bar du bya ba'o //
translated: One should perform up to the prophecy.

translated: Therein, the so-called secret consecration is secret for the person who does not take the vows other than the common ones, and therefore it is called the secret consecration.

original: de la de bstan pa la dgos pa med pas so //
analyzed: de la de bstan pa la dgos pa med pas so //

original: gzhan dag 'di sgrub pa po la gsang zhes 'dod pa ni mi 'thad de /

analyzed: bar ma 'di la yang dbugs dbyung ba med do //
translated: This is the medium, and it is not the one with the exhalation.

original: 'di ni dbugs kyang dbyung ste /

analyzed: de nas dang po thun mong gi sdom pa la gnas te /
